publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3038 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Inverness and District Friends of ARMS-That the Parliament congratulates Inverness and District Friends of ARMS group on its successful bid for NHS Highland funding; notes the group's efforts in the delivery of an invaluable physiotherapy service to Inverness and the rest of the Highlands; welcomes the fact that the provision of an MS specialist nurse will be additional to the direct funding; recognises the part played by the MS Society Scotland, and undertakes to keep the issue of specialised, rural health provision at the forefront of national debate.

S1M-3038 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Inverness and District Friends of ARMS-That the Parliament congratulates Inverness and District Friends of ARMS group on its successful bid for NHS Highland funding; notes the group's efforts in the delivery of an invaluable physiotherapy service to Inverness and the rest of the Highlands; welcomes the fact that the provision of an MS specialist nurse will be additional to the direct funding; recognises the part played by the MS Society Scotland, and undertakes to keep the issue of specialised, rural health provision at the forefront of national debate
S1M-3038 Inverness and District Friends of ARMS (lodged on 25 April 2002) Mary Scanlon*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3038 Inverness and District Friends of ARMS (lodged on 25 April 2002) Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3038 Inverness and District Friends of ARMS (lodged on 25 April 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3038 Inverness and District Friends of ARMS (lodged on 25 April 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-3038 Inverness and District Friends of ARMS (lodged on 25 April 2002) Fergus Ewing*
